definitions.definition: A lever operated by one's foot that is used to control or power a machine or mechanism, such as a bicycle or piano .
examples: There are three pedals on manual cars, two on automatics.
A piano usually has two or three pedals .

definitions.definition: an orthopedic structure or a footlike part.
An effects unit , especially one designed to be activated by being stepped on.
The ranks of pipes played from the pedal-board of an organ.
examples: A small organ commonly has only one or two ranks on the pedal .

main_definition: A lever operated by one's foot that is used to control or power a machine or mechanism, such as a bicycle or piano .
secondary_definitions: ( medicine ) an orthopedic structure or a footlike part.
( music ) An effects unit , especially one designed to be activated by being stepped on.
( music ) The ranks of pipes played from the pedal-board of an organ.
